docs.title: CAS User Guide
docs.text: Welcome to the CAS (Call Activation System) User Guide. This documentation will walk you through the complete process of setting up and using the CAS system.

docs.title: What is CAS?
docs.text:
The Call Activation System (CAS) is a case management and AA (Appropriate Adult) assignment system designed for Care Corner Singapore's AAYS scheme. CAS helps you:

  • Create Cases: Quickly create cases when Investigation Officers call in

  • Smart Assignment: Automatically broadcast to eligible AAs with weighted selection

  • Real-time Monitoring: Track case status and AA responses in real-time

  • Fair Distribution: Ensure cases are fairly distributed among AAs

  • VPRMS Integration: Sync with Salesforce VPRMS for AA profiles and case outcomes

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
System configuration and administration

  • Pre-criteria
  • User Creation
  • System Rules
  • Codes Table
  • Interview Location Setup
  • AA Management
  • Badges & Achievements
  • Audit Logs
  • System Monitoring

docs.title: How to Create Case
docs.text:
Create and manage cases

  • Create Case
  • Monitor Broadcast

docs.title: Reporting & Analytics
docs.text:
Operational and management reporting

  • Reports Overview

docs.title: 📝 Create Case
docs.text: This guide will walk you through creating a new case in CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: When an Investigation Officer (IO) calls to request an Appropriate Adult, you will create a new case in CAS. The system will then broadcast to eligible AAs based on the case requirements.

docs.title: Quick Start (Most common flow)
docs.text:
1. Go to Cases → Create New Case
  2. Add youth information and number of AAs required
  3. Set interview schedule and location
  4. Add IO contact details
  5. Add special requirements (optional)
  6. Choose Assignment Method (Broadcast, manual assignment or data entry)
  7. Click Start Broadcast

docs.title: How Case Broadcast Works
docs.text:
Broadcast Types:

Type Name AA Pool When Used B1 Standard Broadcast Primary region AAs First broadcast B2 Secondary Region Primary + Secondary region AAs Re-broadcasts B3 Staff-Only AA Staff only (ignores preferences) Urgent final attempt

Broadcast Flow:

  1. Broadcast 1 (B1) → Case sent to AAs in primary region
  2. Holding Period (5 mins) → System collects multiple responses
  3. Weighted Selection → If multiple responses, system selects based on workload:
  4. Bucket A (0-2 cases/month): 60% chance
  5. Bucket B (3-6 cases/month): 30% chance
  6. Bucket C (7+ cases/month): 10% chance
  7. Waiting Period (10 mins) → FCFS if no response during holding
  8. Confirmation (5 mins) → Selected AA must confirm assignment
  9. Broadcast 2 (B2) → Expands to secondary regions if no confirmation
  10. Broadcast 3 (B3) → Staff-only broadcast for urgent cases

Urgency Classification:

Classification Condition Broadcast Sequence Standard Interview > 4 hours away B1 → B2 → B2... Urgent Interview ≤ 4 hours away B1 → B2 → B3 Last Minute Interview ≤ 90 mins (AA cancels) Force B3 immediately

8-Stage Filtering: Before broadcast, system filters AAs by: Qualifications → Region → Timing → Gender → Language → Race → Cooldown → Quiet Hours

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Cases
docs.text: Login to CAS Web Portal. In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Cases

docs.title: Step 2: Click Create New Case
docs.text: Click Create New Case button

docs.title: Step 3: Fill Youth Information
docs.text:
Fill in the youth details:

  • Youth Name – Full name of young suspect (required)
  • Youth Age – Age of youth (6-17 years)
  • Youth Gender – Male / Female / Other (required)

If more than one youth, click Add New Youth to add additional youth (maximum 7).

Then input the Number of AAs Required for this case.

docs.title: Step 4: Fill Offense Details
docs.text: Select the Specific Offense from the offense list dropdown.

docs.title: Step 5: Specify Interview Schedule
docs.text:
• Interview Date – Date of interview
  • Interview Time – Time of interview
  • Location – Police station or other location
  • House Visit – Check if interview requires house visit

If House Visit is checked, the House Visit qualification requirement will be automatically added.

docs.title: Step 6: Fill IO Information
docs.text:
• IO Name – Investigation Officer's full name (required)
  • Contact Number – Primary phone (8 digits, starts with 6/8/9)
  • Alt Contact Number – Alternative phone, optional (8 digits, starts with 6/8/9)

docs.title: Step 7: Select Special Requirements (Optional)
docs.text:
If the case requires specific AA characteristics:

  • Gender – Male or Female AA preferred
  • Race – Preferred ethnicity
  • Language – Required spoken language
  • Qualifications – Additional qualifications needed

docs.title: Step 8: Choose Assignment Method
docs.text:
• Broadcast – Notify all eligible AAs via automated selection.
  • Manual Assignment – Select a specific AA directly.
  • Data Entry Only – Record completed case without notification. Use for cases completed offline, for records only.

Broadcast:

If you choose Broadcast, CAS will show:

  • The number of eligible AAs for this case (based on the criteria you entered)
  • Case-level assignment timing parameters that you can adjust for this specific case before starting:
  • Holding Period
  • Waiting Period
  • Confirmation Period

Manual Assignment:

If you choose Manual Assignment, you can view the list of eligible AAs, pick an AA by name and select manual assignment reason droplist.

Urgent manual assignment: If the manual assignment reason is Urgent, the AA must respond within 3 minutes.

Data Entry Only:

This method is used to record cases that were completed offline — no notification will be sent to AA, and the case goes directly to Completed status.

  • AA Name – Shows all AAs for selection (search by name available)
  • Youth Name – Auto-filled from youth info entered above

docs.title: Step 9: Start Broadcast/ Assignement or Save
docs.text:
• Start Broadcast or Start Assignment – Save and start broadcast/ assignment immediately
  • Save as Draft – Save case to broadcast/ assignment later

docs.title: 🎥 Video Tutorial
docs.text: Follow this short video to see how each case assignment method is created and how it appears on the AA mobile app!

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: After creating a case: Monitor Broadcast - Track AA responses and to edit or cancel a case, follow the steps in this page

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Phone validation error: Ensure phone is 8 digits starting with 6, 8, or 9

Can't start broadcast: Check all required fields are filled

docs.title: 📊 Monitor Broadcast
docs.text: This guide will walk you through monitoring a broadcast in CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This page explains how to monitor and manage a case after it is created (especially during broadcast). It covers dashboard monitoring, viewing case details and tabs (Documentations/Assignment Method/Audit Logs), role-based access (who can view/edit documentation and payable status), and operational actions such as manual assignment, editing (when allowed), cancelling, and completion rules.

docs.title: Dashboard & Monitoring
docs.text:
You can monitor cases either from:

  • Dashboard (operational view for multiple cases), or
  • Cases → Case Details (deep-dive into a specific case)

docs.title: What You Can See on the Dashboard
docs.text:
Typical dashboard information includes:

  • Case ID (format: YY-nnnn)
  • Status (Draft, Broadcasting, Pending Confirmation, Assigned, Completed, Cancelled)
  • Broadcast stage
  • Location
  • Interview Schedule
  • Number of Youth, AA required and AA responded

docs.title: Live Broadcast Monitoring (Operational View)
docs.text: In a typical dashboard view, you will see multiple cases listed as cards. Each case card may include a countdown timer for Time to Interview, so staff can quickly prioritize urgent cases.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Cases
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Cases

docs.title: Step 2: Select Case
docs.text: Choose the specific case you want to monitor from the list

docs.title: Step 3: View Details Tab
docs.text: In the Details tab, you can see the Case ID, current Status, Youth Information (name, age, gender), Interview Details (date, time, location), IO Information, and any Special Requirements.

docs.title: Step 4: View Documentations Tab
docs.text:
View AA documentation after they submit it:

  • Photos uploaded by AA
  • Timestamps
  • Notes/remarks

Role-based access (Documentations Tab):

  • Call Centre Staff: Can only see Timestamp (cannot view submitted documentation content and cannot see Payable status)
  • AAYS Manager / System Administrator: Can view all details and can Edit Documentation and Payable Status

How to Edit Documentation (Manager/Admin):

  1. Select the documentation entry you want to update
  2. Edit fields as needed:
  3. Timestamp
  4. Remarks
  5. Photos (add/remove/replace)
  6. Payable status (toggle on/off)
  7. Click Save Changes to apply updates

docs.title: Step 5: View Assignment Method Tab
docs.text: View assignment details including Assignment Type (Broadcast / Manual / Data Entry), current Status, and AA Response Log showing history of responses.

docs.title: View Audit Logs Tab
docs.text:
View case history edited by the user, and what was changed, and when each action occurred.

Note: Audit Logs access requires AAYS Manager (case-related) or System Administrator role.

docs.title: Cancellation Rules
docs.text:
• During Broadcast → Broadcast stops, all pending notifications cleared
  • AA Already Assigned → AA receives cancellation notification and has 30 minutes to acknowledge:
  • Case status is Cancelling if the AA has acknowledged but has not submitted documentation yet
  • Case status automatically changes to Cancelled when the AA submits documentation, or after 30 minutes if the AA does not acknowledge and does not submit documentation

docs.title: Who Can Cancel
docs.text:
• Call Centre Staff
  • AAYS Manager
  • System Administrator

Note: Cancelled cases cannot be restored. If needed, create a new case.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to the case you want to cancel -> Click Cancel button
Step 2: Select a Cancellation Reason and add Remarks if needed
Case Completion
docs.text:
Important: For cases with multiple AAs and multiple youths:

  • Case status changes to Completed only when ALL assigned AAs have submitted their documentation
  • Each AA must submit documentation for their assigned youth(s)
  • You can track individual AA submission status in the Documentations Tab

docs.title: Edit Case
docs.text:
You can only edit a case when:

  • Broadcast is stopped (status = Draft)
  • No AA has been assigned yet

docs.title: How to Stop Broadcast / Assignment (Quick steps)
docs.text: If the case is Broadcasting and no AA has been assigned yet:

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to the case you want to stop -> Click Stop button
Step 2: Click Stop Assignment to confirm stopping
Step 4: Update case details as needed (e.g., interview schedule, location, requirements)
Step 5: If needed, switch Assignment Method (Broadcast ↔ Manual Assignment)
Step 6: Click Save to apply changes on case details or Confirm Assignment to apply changes on assignment method
Step 7: Click Start Assignment to re-broadcast this case or to do manual assignment
docs.text: Note: You cannot switch a broadcasting case to Data Entry Only. Data Entry is used only when the interview is already completed offline and you are recording the case for reporting purposes.

docs.title: 🎥 Video Tutorial
docs.text: Follow this short video to see how to initiate case cancellation via web portal, how AA acknowledge cancellation case and edit case while broadcasting.

docs.title: Stop broadcast to edit a case (no AA assigned yet)
📈 Reporting & Analytics
docs.text: This section explains the reports available in CAS and how to use them.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Reports help Call Centre Staff and AAYS Management track performance, coverage gaps, and operational metrics. Most reports support filtering and export.

Who can access reports (typical permission model):

  • Call Centre Staff: Can access Call Centre Operational Reports (day-to-day operational tracking)
  • AAYS Manager: Can access all report categories (operational + management/KPI dashboards)
  • System Administrator: Can access all report categories (and manages system configuration)

docs.title: Step 1: Open Reporting
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, open Reports.

docs.title: Step 2: Select a Report Tab
docs.text: Each report is shown as a tab. Click the tab you want to view.

docs.title: Step 3: Filter by Date Range
docs.text: Select the date range you want to report on.

docs.title: Step 5: Export
docs.text: Click Export (CSV/Excel) to download the filtered results.

docs.title: Report Categories (Summary)
docs.text: Below is a simplified summary of the reporting modules described in the functional specification.

docs.title: Call Centre Operational Reports
docs.text:
Used for day-to-day operational tracking.

  • Total Cases Created
  • Cases Completed
  • Cases Cancelled
  • Activation calls (cases broadcasted)
  • Manpower deployed (total AAs activated)
  • Case recalls/edits (edits after broadcast)
  • Mean number of activations
  • Median number of activations

docs.title: AAYS Management Reports
docs.text:
Used for program KPIs and oversight.

  • No. of AA/staff activations
  • No. of regular AAs (4+ monthly cases)
  • No. of AA hours (total service hours)
  • No. of beneficiaries served (youth assisted count)
  • No. of activations by type of offense
  • No. of activations by region
  • No. of activations from 2300hrs to 0700hrs
  • No. of activations that are home visits
  • No. of activations that are not Divisions/NPCs
  • No. of activations by agency
  • No. of AAs activated by region

docs.title: Notification Delivery Reports
docs.text:
Used to troubleshoot push notification delivery.

  • Sent / delivered / viewed counts
  • Failed deliveries

docs.title: AA Engagement Reports
docs.text:
Used to track response behaviour.

  • Response rates, acceptance/rejection rates
  • Response time trends

docs.title: Assignment Completion Reports
docs.text:
Used to track the full lifecycle and drop-offs.

  • Broadcasted → Accepted → Pending Confirmation → Assigned/Confirmed → Completed/Cancelled
  • Drop-off rates and time-to-confirmation / time-to-documentation

docs.title: Transport Allowance Reports
docs.text:
Used for allowance disbursement tracking.

  • Payable vs not payable documentation counts
  • Overrides and remarks

docs.title: Last-minute Staff Activations
docs.text:
Used to track urgent escalation cases.

  • Staff-only broadcasts (B3) volume
  • Last-minute triggers
  • Breakdown by region/time

docs.title: MHA Monthly Report
docs.text:
Used for monthly submission.

  • Agency/region summaries
  • Case outcomes and required reporting fields

docs.title: Volunteer Feedback / Wellbeing
docs.text:
Used to monitor AA wellbeing.

  • Post-interview feedback ratings

docs.title: AA Management
docs.text: This guide explains how AAYS Managers and System Administrators manage Appropriate Adult (AA) profiles and availability in the CAS Web Portal.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
AA data is primarily maintained in Salesforce VPRMS and synced to CAS. In the Web Portal, managers typically use AA management tools to:

  • Search and view AA profiles
  • Override availability (when needed for operations)
  • Review qualifications and preferences that affect broadcast eligibility

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Open AA Management
  2. Search/filter for an AA
  3. Review profile details (qualifications, regions, timing preferences, status)
  4. Apply overrides if required (availability / pause / notes)

docs.title: Step 1: Open AA Management
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to AA Management.

docs.title: Step 2: Find an AA
docs.text:
• Use search and filters to find the AA you need (e.g., by name, email)
  • Click the View (eye) icon to open the AA profile

docs.title: Step 3: Review Profile
docs.text:
Common information includes:

  • AA identity
  • Qualifications
  • Regions
  • Timing preferences
  • Availability / pause status
  • AA Statistics

docs.title: Step 4: Edit AA Profile
docs.text:
✏️ Who can edit AA profiles: Only AAYS Manager and System Administrator can edit AA profiles.

If you are Call Centre Staff, the edit pen icon will appear greyed out, meaning the profile is read-only in CAS.

Depending on permissions and configuration, editable fields typically include:

  • Contact Number
  • Address
  • Primary Region and Secondary Region
  • Preference Time Slots
  • Qualifications
  • Low Priority (toggle)
  • Notification Preferences (in the Notification Preferences tab, if available)

docs.title: Step 5: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Save to apply changes.

docs.title: Audit Logs
docs.text: This guide explains how to use Audit Logs in CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Audit Logs provide a complete record of all actions performed in the CAS system. This helps with:

  • Accountability: Track who did what and when
  • Troubleshooting: Investigate issues by reviewing action history
  • Compliance: Maintain records for audit purposes
  • Security: Monitor for unauthorized or unusual activity

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
1. Open Audit Logs
  2. Filter by date range, user, or action type
  3. Click any entry to review details
  4. Export if needed (CSV)

docs.title: What Audit Trail Includes
docs.text:
Audit logs capture who did what, when, and what changed. Based on the functional specification, audit trail typically includes:

  • Case lifecycle & case actions
  • Create/edit case, status transitions, start/stop broadcast, manual assignment, re-broadcast/escalation

  • Case cancellation details: cancelled by (user), reason, timestamp

  • User & authentication activities

  • Login/logout

  • User created/updated/deactivated (accounts are preserved; deletion is not permanent)

  • System configuration changes

  • System rules/config updates with before/after values (e.g., setting changed from old value to new value)

Note: Audit logs are used for accountability and compliance, and support troubleshooting by showing a full timeline of actions.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Audit Logs
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Audit Logs

docs.title: Step 2: View Log Entries
docs.text:
The audit log displays:

  • Timestamp – Date and time of action
  • User – Who performed the action
  • Action – What action was performed
  • Details – Specific details of the change
  • IP Address – Source IP (for security tracking)

docs.title: Filter and Export (Optional)
docs.text:
• Filter by date range: Select start and end dates to narrow down the log entries
  • Export: Apply your filters, then click Download to export (CSV)

docs.title: Logged Actions
docs.text: The following actions are recorded in Audit Logs:

docs.title: User Actions
docs.text:
• User login / logout
  • User created / edited / deactivated
  • Password reset

docs.title: Case Actions
docs.text:
• Case created / edited / cancelled
  • Broadcast started / stopped
  • AA assigned / unassigned
  • Case status changes

docs.title: System Actions
docs.text:
• System rules changed
  • Configuration updates
  • Sync events (VPRMS)

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Can't find specific log: Expand date range, check spelling of search terms

docs.title: Badges & Achievements
docs.text: This guide explains how administrators/AAYS Manager configure badge/achievement features in CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Badges and achievements are designed to encourage AA engagement and recognise contributions. AAs typically view badges in the CAS Mobile App.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Achievements
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Achievements

docs.title: Step 2: Define Badge Rules
docs.text:
Click Create New Badge and fill in details:

  • Badge name
  • Description
  • Rule Type (e.g., documentation compliance, punctuality, special recognition)
  • Thresholds (what counts as “earned”)
  • Badge image

docs.title: Step 3: Save and Verify
docs.text:
Click Create, then confirm:

  • AAs can see the badge menu (if enabled)
  • Badge progress and earned notifications behave as expected

docs.title: Step 1: Select a Badge
docs.text: Go to Achievements and select the badge you want to edit.

docs.title: Step 2: Click Edit
docs.text: Click the Edit (pen) icon.

docs.title: Step 3: Update Badge Details
docs.text:
Update fields as needed:

  • Badge name
  • Description
  • Rule Type
  • Thresholds
  • Badge image

docs.title: Step 4: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Update to apply changes.

docs.title: View AAs Who Earned a Badge
Step 1: Open Badge Details
docs.text: Go to Achievements and open the badge you want to review.

docs.title: Step 2: View Earned List
docs.text: View the list of AAs who have earned the badge.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Badge definitions and thresholds are typically policy-driven (program rules).
  • If gamification is not enabled, the menu may be hidden on the AA Mobile App.

docs.title: Codes Table
docs.text: This guide explains the Codes Table and how it syncs with VPRMS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Codes Table contains reference (master) data used throughout CAS as picklist/dropdown values (e.g., gender, race, qualifications, regions).

This data is maintained in VPRMS and synced from VPRMS to CAS automatically.

In addition to standard code sets (Gender/Race/Qualification, etc.), CAS can also be configured with additional code types to support CAS picklists (for example Police Division, Cancellation Reason or Offense Type).

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Codes Table
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Codes Table

docs.title: Step 2: View Synced Data
docs.text:
The following information is synced from VPRMS to CAS:

  • Qualifications – AA certifications (e.g., YS Under 10, House Visit)
  • Race – Ethnicity options
  • Gender – Gender options
  • Region – Police regions (North, South, East, West, Central)
  • Language – Spoken languages
  • Timing Preference – Preferred time windows for AA availability (used for scheduling and broadcast eligibility)

You can also quickly find and review codes using the page controls:

  • Search: Search by code name
  • Filter by Type: Narrow down to a specific code type
  • Filter by Status: View Active/Inactive codes
  • Filter by Access: Show Read-only (synced) vs Editable (admin-created) codes

⚠️ Important (Edit icon): If the edit pen icon is greyed out, it means the code is synced from Salesforce (VPRMS) and is read-only in CAS. To update it, make the change in Salesforce and wait for the next sync (or run Sync with VPRMS).

docs.title: Sync Schedule
docs.text:
• Automatic – Every 30 minutes (polling for updates)
  • Daily Full Sync – 2:00 AM (complete data reconciliation)
  • Manual Sync – On-demand (triggered by System Administrator)

docs.title: Manual Sync (Optional)
docs.text: If you need to sync immediately (e.g., after adding new values in VPRMS), click Sync with VPRMS and wait for completion. New values will appear in the table.

docs.title: Create a New Code
docs.text: If you need to add a new picklist value to a code type (e.g., Police Division, Offense Type, Cancellation Reason) and your role has access.

docs.title: Step 1: Go to Codes Table and click Create Code
docs.text: Click Create Code to open the form.

docs.title: Step 2: Fill in Details
docs.text:
• Label
  • Code
  • Type (select from the dropdown)
  • Description

docs.title: Step 3: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Create to save changes.

docs.title: Edit an Existing Code (Admin-created)
docs.text: If the code was created in CAS (not synced), you can edit it:

docs.title: Step 1: Click Edit
docs.text: Click the blue edit pen icon.

docs.title: Step 2: Update Details
docs.text:
Update fields as needed:

  • Edit Label and/or Description
  • Toggle Active off to inactivate the code

docs.title: Step 3: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Update to save changes.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
New value not appearing: Wait for next sync cycle or trigger manual sync

Sync failed: Check VPRMS connection, contact System Administrator

docs.title: Interview Location Setup
docs.text: This guide explains how to manage interview locations used in CAS picklists.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Interview locations are used when creating a case (Interview Schedule → Location). Keeping this list accurate helps Call Centre Staff select the correct venue quickly.

docs.title: Step 1: Go to Interview Location
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Interview Location.

docs.title: Step 2: Click Create New Interview Location
docs.text:
Fill in the following fields:

  • Active – Toggle on/off to activate or deactivate the location
  • Interview Location Name – Location name displayed in the case picklist
  • Address – Full address
  • Block/Building – Block or building name (if applicable)
  • Postal Code – Postal code
  • Region – Select the region from the dropdown

docs.title: Step 3: Click Create
docs.text: Click Create to create a new interview location.

docs.title: Step 1: Find the Location
docs.text: Go to Interview Location and find the location you want to update

docs.title: Step 2: Click Edit
docs.text: Click the Edit (pen) icon.

docs.title: Step 3: Update Details
docs.text:
Update fields as needed:

  • Edit Interview Location Name, Address, Block/Building, Postal Code, or Region
  • Toggle Active off to inactivate the location

docs.title: Step 4: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Update to save changes.

docs.title: Pre-criteria
docs.text: This guide outlines the prerequisites before using CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Before using the CAS system, ensure you have the following requirements ready.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Before you begin:

  1. Make sure you have valid login credentials for the CAS Web Portal (Call Centre / Manager / System Administrator)
  2. Confirm your role is correctly assigned

docs.title: 1. Valid Login Credentials
docs.text:
Ensure you have valid login credentials for CAS Web Portal.

  • Contact your System Administrator if you don't have credentials
  • First-time users will receive a link to setup password

docs.title: 2. Access Role
docs.text:
Ensure you have the appropriate role assigned:

  • Call Centre Staff (Standard): Create cases, monitor broadcasts, view basic operational reports
  • AAYS Manager (Full): All Call Centre functions + full reports + AA management
  • System Administrator (Admin): All functions + system configuration + user management

docs.title: System Monitoring
docs.text: This guide explains how to view system health and integration status.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The System Monitoring dashboard provides real-time visibility into:

  • VPRMS sync status
  • Authentication/login activity
  • SMS delivery health

docs.title: VPRMS Sync Status
docs.text:
Displays the status of data synchronisation between CAS and VPRMS (Salesforce).

  • Records Pushed: Number of records synced to VPRMS
  • AAs Synced: Number of AA profiles synced
  • Errors (24h): Sync errors in the last 24 hours
  • Last Sync: Timestamp of the most recent sync

A green checkmark (✓) indicates sync is healthy.

docs.title: Authentication Status
docs.text:
Displays login and session activity for Web Portal users.

  • Active Sessions: Number of users currently logged in
  • Logins Today: Total login attempts today
  • Failed Logins: Number of failed login attempts today
  • Azure AD Operational: Indicates Azure AD SSO is working

docs.title: SMS Delivery Status
docs.text:
Displays SMS notification delivery metrics.

  • Sent Today: Total SMS sent today
  • Last Sent: Time of the most recent SMS
  • Delivered: Number of SMS successfully delivered
  • Failed: Number of SMS that failed to deliver
  • Message Delivered: Delivery success rate (%)

A "Healthy" badge indicates SMS delivery is operating normally.

docs.title: Login Activity
docs.text:
The Login Activity table shows recent login attempts to the Web Portal.

Column Description Time Timestamp of the login attempt User Name Name of the user Status Success or Failed Failure Reason Reason for failure (e.g., Invalid OTP) IP Address IP address of the login attempt

This helps administrators monitor for:

  • Unusual login patterns
  • Failed login attempts (security monitoring)
  • User activity auditing

docs.title: System Rules
docs.text: This guide will walk you through configuring system rules in CAS.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: System Rules allow you to customize the behavior of the assignment workflow, weighted selection logic, and other system configurations. These settings are optional and can be adjusted by AAYS Managers and System Administrators.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Most updates follow this flow:

  1. Open the relevant section (Weighted Selection Logic / Assignment Workflow / Configurations)
  2. Update values as needed
  3. Click Save Changes

Tip: Changes apply to new broadcasts only (existing in-progress broadcasts are unaffected).

docs.title: Weighted Selection Logic
docs.text: Configure how AAs are selected for case assignments.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Weighted Selection Logic
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to System Rules → Weighted Selection Logic

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Weighted Balance Period Rolling window for case count calculation (days) 30 days Low Priority Reset Duration before low priority flag is cleared (days) 14 days Bucket A Range Monthly cases for 60% probability 0-2 cases Bucket B Range Monthly cases for 30% probability 3-6 cases Bucket C Range Monthly cases for 10% probability 7+ cases

docs.title: Step 3: Click Save Changes
docs.text: Click Save Changes to apply the new settings.

docs.title: Assignment Workflow
docs.text: Configure timing parameters for the broadcast and assignment process.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Assignment Workflow
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to System Rules → Assignment Workflow

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Holding Period Collection time for Broadcast 1 (minutes) 5 mins Waiting Period FCFS window after holding, applies to all broadcasts (minutes) 10 mins Confirmation Period Time for AA to confirm after selection (minutes) 5 mins Interview Reminder Period Reminder sent before interview time (hours) 2 hours Documentation Reminder Reminder sent after interview time if documentation is still pending (hours) 4 hours Urgency Threshold Time threshold to mark case as Urgent (hours) 4 hours Cooldown Period Rest period for AA after assignment (hours) 3 hours

docs.title: Step 3: Click Save Changes
docs.text: Click Save Changes to apply the new settings.

docs.title: Configurations
docs.text: Configure general system settings.

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Configurations
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to System Rules → Configurations

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Call Centre Inactivity Timeout Auto-logout for web portal (hours) 2 hours Mobile App Inactivity Timeout Auto-logout for mobile app (hours) 0.5 hours Transport Allowance Reimbursement amount per case (dollars) $50

docs.title: Step 3: Click Save Changes
docs.text: Click Save Changes to apply the new settings.

docs.title: Important Notes
docs.text:
• Changes apply to new broadcasts only (existing in-progress broadcasts are unaffected)
  • All configuration changes are logged in Audit Logs
  • Only AAYS Manager and System Administrator can modify these settings

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Settings not saving: Check you have the correct permissions (AAYS Manager or System Administrator)

Changes not taking effect: Changes only apply to new broadcasts, not existing ones

docs.title: User Creation
docs.text: This guide will walk you through creating and managing user accounts.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: User management is available to System Administrators only. This section covers how to create, edit, and manage user accounts for the CAS Web Portal.

docs.title: Role Permissions
docs.text: Different roles have different capabilities in CAS:

docs.title: Call Centre Staff
docs.text:
• ✅ View case dashboard (real-time status)
  • ✅ Create and edit cases
  • ✅ Start/Stop broadcast
  • ✅ Manual AA assignment
  • ✅ Cancel cases
  • ✅ View AA profiles (read-only)
  • ❌ Cannot create completed cases (Data Entry)
  • ❌ Cannot access advanced reports
  • ❌ Cannot configure system settings

docs.title: AAYS Manager
docs.text:
• ✅ All Call Centre Staff functions
  • ✅ Full reporting access (all dashboards)
  • ✅ AA management (override availability, view qualifications)
  • ✅ Data export (CSV)
  • ✅ Configure assignment logic
  • ✅ View case-related audit logs only
  • ❌ Cannot perform user management

docs.title: System Administrator
docs.text:
• ✅ All AAYS Manager functions
  • ✅ User management (create/edit/deactivate users)
  • ✅ System configuration (notifications, integrations)
  • ✅ Full Audit Logs access

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Users
docs.text: In the left-hand side menu, navigate to Users

docs.title: Step 2: Click Create User
docs.text: Click the Create User button

docs.title: Step 3: Fill In User Details
docs.text:
Fill in the following information:

  • Name – User's full name
  • Email – Login email address
  • Role – Select: AAYS Manager, System Administrator, or Call Centre Staff

docs.title: Step 4: Click Create
docs.text:
Click Create to save the new user.

The user will receive email with a link to create password.

docs.title: Step 1: Select User
docs.text:
• Click on the user name in the Users list
  • Click Edit button

docs.title: Step 2: Update Details
docs.text:
• Modify the user information as needed
  • Toggle off Active if you want to deactivate user

What happens when a user is deactivated:

  • ❌ User cannot login to CAS
  • ❌ If user is an AA, they will not receive any broadcasts
  • ✅ User records and history are preserved
  • ✅ User can be reactivated anytime

docs.title: Step 3: Save Changes
docs.text: Click Update to apply changes

docs.title: ⚠️ Important: Users Cannot Be Deleted
docs.text:
CAS does not allow permanent deletion of user accounts. Users can only be deactivated.

Reasons:

  • 📋 Audit Trail – All user actions must be traceable for compliance
  • 🔗 Data Integrity – Cases and logs reference user accounts
  • 📁 Record Keeping – Historical data must be preserved

If you need to remove a user, simply deactivate them. Their account will remain in the system but they will not be able to access CAS.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
User can't login: Check if user status is Active, try resetting password

Wrong permissions: Verify the correct role is assigned

Not receiving emails: Check email address is correct, check spam folder
